alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Interior Rockingham; Merrimack; Strafford (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 3:25PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Rockingham, western Strafford, southeastern Belknap and east central Merrimack Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 325 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Loudon, or near Concord, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Concord, Northwood, Barrington, Farmington, Loudon, Alton, Barnstead, Epsom, Gilmanton, Canterbury, Deerfield, Boscawen, Chichester, Strafford, Pittsfield, New Durham, Pembroke and Middleton. This includes Interstate 93 between mile markers 38 and 50. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central and southern New Hampshire.
